io.odysz.transact.sql

Class Statement<T extends Statement<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.odysz.transact.sql.parts.AbsPart
      • io.odysz.transact.sql.Statement<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - insert/update/delete/...
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Delete, Insert, Query, Update

    public abstract class Statement<T extends Statement<T>>
extends AbsPart
    Statement like inert, update - the structured API.
    Design Notes:
    Statement don't know semantic context. Only when committing, it's needed.
    Author:
    odys-z@github.com

      void doneOp(Statement.IPostOperat operat)
      Set done operation - typically a database statement committing.
      See Query.rs(ISemantext)
      T post(ArrayList<Statement<?>> posts) 
      T post(Statement<?> postatement)
      Add post semantics after the parent statement, like add children after insert new parent.
      Side effect: the added post statement's context is changed - to referencing the same instance for resolving, etc.
      T where_(String op, String lcol, String rconst)
      This is a wraper of where(String, String, String) for convenient - the third arg is taken as a string constant and added single quotes at begin and end.

      • where_

        public T where_(String op,
                String lcol,
                String rconst)
        This is a wraper of where(String, String, String) for convenient - the third arg is taken as a string constant and added single quotes at begin and end.
        Parameters:
        op -
        lcol - left column
        rconst - right constant will be adding single quotes "''"
        Returns:

      • post

        public T post(Statement<?> postatement)
        Add post semantics after the parent statement, like add children after insert new parent.
        Side effect: the added post statement's context is changed - to referencing the same instance for resolving, etc.
        Parameters:
        postatement -
        Returns:
        the calling statement
